narrative: Brief, friendly small talk shows minor misnaming and mild awkwardness, while signals point to elevated stress. Patterns of self-criticism and some avoidance appear alongside a drive to decide and seek support. A quick reset and clearer focus could reduce tension and smooth the interaction.
takeaways: Do a 60-second reset before/at start: 3 cycles of 4-4-6 breathing, confirm name and purpose, then set a one-line agenda (e.g., “Aaron, right? Top thing to cover today is X—sound good?”).

When slips happen, use ‘correct-and-continue’: briefly correct the name once, then immediately ask a focusing question; keep the correct name and 1–2 goals at the top of your notes to prevent rumination.
